# daethon
> A simple Python daemonizer

This contains a Python class that will daemonize your Python script so it can continue running in the background. It works on Unix, Linux and macOS.

This was originally a fork from [**serverdensity/python-daemon**][2], which then was based on the original version from [**jejik.com**][3]. However, I wanted to modernize the project to fully support the latest features of python3, which would completely break the compatibility. Therefore, I decided to create my own variation named [**daethon**][4].


### Usage
Define a class that inherits from `Daemon` and has a `run()` method *(which is what will be called once the daemonization is completed)*.

```Python
from daethon import Daemon

class MyDaemon(Daemon):
	def run(self):
		# Do stuff

if __name__ == '__main__':
    a_daemon = MyDaemon('/path/to/pidfile.pid')
	a_daemon.start()
```

##### Available actions
- `start()` - starts the daemon (creates PID and daemonizes).
- `stop()` - stops the daemon (stops the child process and removes the PID).
- `restart()` - does `stop()` then `start()`.

##### Foreground mode
This is useful for debugging because you can view the code running without making it a daemon. The running script then depends on an open shell like any normal Python script.
To do this, just call the `run()` method directly.

```Python
a_daemon.run()
```

##### Continuous execution
The `run()` method will be executed just once so if you want the daemon to be doing stuff continuously you may wish to use the [sched][5] module.


### INSTALLATION

##### Requirements
- Python >= 3.6
- eventlet
- gevent

##### Install with `pip`
```Python
pip install daethon
```

##### Clone from Github
```
$ git clone https://github.com/lqmanh/daethon
$ cd daethon
$ pip install -r requirements.txt
$ pip install .
```
